alert.note: Alert for Catoosa (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 5:26AM EST until February 24 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...Tennessee... South Chickamauga Creek Near Chickamauga TN affecting Hamilton and Catoosa Counties. For the South Chickamauga...including Chickamauga TN...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Chickamauga Creek near Chickamauga TN. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to cross Mack Smith Road in Catoosa County, Georgia. Flooding begins at golf courses near the confluence of South and West Chickamauga Creeks. West Chickamauga Creek begins to overflow its banks, as well. At 19.0 feet, Water across Mack Smith road begins to impede traffic. West Chickamauga Creek overflows its banks near the Georgia state line and inundates several roads and properties in the area. At 20.0 feet, Mack Smith Road is closed. Water crosses Lovell Field Loop, the access road around the north end of the airport runway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM EST Thursday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.9 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 04/24/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM EST.
